{{cpp/title|ends}}
{{cpp/io/manip/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=ostream|
template&lt; class CharT, class Traits &gt;
std::basic_ostream&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;&amp; ends( std::basic_ostream&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;&amp; os );
}}

Inserts a null character into the output sequence {{c|os}} as if by calling {{c|os.put(CharT())}}. 

This is an output-only I/O manipulator, it may be called with an expression such as {{c|out &lt;&lt; std::ends}} for any {{tt|out}} of type {{lc|std::basic_ostream}}.

===Notes===
This manipulator is typically used with {{c|std::ostrstream}}, when the associated output buffer needs to be null-terminated to be processed as a C string.

Unlike {{lc|std::endl}}, this manipulator does not flush the stream.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|os|reference to output stream}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{c|os}} (reference to the stream after insertion of the null character).

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cstdio&gt;
#include &lt;strstream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::ostrstream oss;
    oss &lt;&lt; "Sample text: " &lt;&lt; 42 &lt;&lt; std::ends;
    std::printf("%s\n", oss.str());
    oss.freeze(false); // enable memory deallocation
}
|output=
Sample text: 42
}}
